trans-unit.source: Validating Universal Windows drivers
trans-unit.target: Validating Universal Windows drivers

trans-unit.source: You can use the ApiValidator.exe tool to verify that the APIs that your driver calls are valid for a Universal Windows driver.
trans-unit.target: You can use the ApiValidator.exe tool to verify that the APIs that your driver calls are valid for a Universal Windows driver.

trans-unit.source: The tool returns an error if your driver calls an API that is outside the set of valid APIs for Universal Windows drivers.
trans-unit.target: The tool returns an error if your driver calls an API that is outside the set of valid APIs for Universal Windows drivers.

trans-unit.source: This tool is part of the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) for Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: This tool is part of the Windows Driver Kit (WDK) for Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Running ApiValidator in Visual Studio
trans-unit.target: Running ApiValidator in Visual Studio

trans-unit.source: If the **Target Platform** property of your driver project is set to **Universal**, Visual Studio runs ApiValidator automatically as a post-build step.
trans-unit.target: If the **Target Platform** property of your driver project is set to **Universal**, Visual Studio runs ApiValidator automatically as a post-build step.

trans-unit.source: To view all the messages displayed by ApiValidator, navigate to **Tools > Options > Projects and Solutions > Build and Run**, and set **MSBuild project build output verbosity** to **Detailed**.
trans-unit.target: To view all the messages displayed by ApiValidator, navigate to **Tools > Options > Projects and Solutions > Build and Run**, and set **MSBuild project build output verbosity** to **Detailed**.

trans-unit.source: When building from the command line, add the switch **/v:detailed** or **/v:diag** to your build command to increase the verbosity.
trans-unit.target: When building from the command line, add the switch **/v:detailed** or **/v:diag** to your build command to increase the verbosity.

trans-unit.source: For the umdf2\_fx2 driver sample, API validation errors look this:
trans-unit.target: For the umdf2\_fx2 driver sample, API validation errors look this:

trans-unit.source: Fixing validation errors
trans-unit.target: Fixing validation errors

trans-unit.source: If you switched a legacy desktop driver to universal, verify that you are including the correct libraries.
trans-unit.target: If you switched a legacy desktop driver to universal, verify that you are including the correct libraries.

trans-unit.source: Right click the project and choose properties.
trans-unit.target: Right click the project and choose properties.

trans-unit.source: Navigate to **Linker->Input**.
trans-unit.target: Navigate to **Linker->Input**.

trans-unit.source: The **Additional Dependencies** should contain:
trans-unit.target: The **Additional Dependencies** should contain:

trans-unit.source: Remove or replace the non-universal API calls one at a time and rerun the tool until there are no errors.
trans-unit.target: Remove or replace the non-universal API calls one at a time and rerun the tool until there are no errors.

trans-unit.source: Running ApiValidator from the Command Prompt
trans-unit.target: Running ApiValidator from the Command Prompt

trans-unit.source: You can also run Apivalidator.exe from the command prompt.
trans-unit.target: You can also run Apivalidator.exe from the command prompt.

trans-unit.source: In your WDK installation, navigate to C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\bin\\*<arch>*.
trans-unit.target: In your WDK installation, navigate to C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\bin\\*<arch>*.

trans-unit.source: Use the following syntax:
trans-unit.target: Use the following syntax:

trans-unit.source: **Apivalidator.exe** **-DriverPackagePath:***<driver folder path>* **-SupportedApiXmlFiles:***<path to XML files containing supported APIs for universal drivers>*
trans-unit.target: **Apivalidator.exe** **-DriverPackagePath:***<driver folder path>* **-SupportedApiXmlFiles:***<path to XML files containing supported APIs for universal drivers>*

trans-unit.source: For example, to verify the APIs called by the Activity sample in the WDK, first build the sample in Visual Studio.
trans-unit.target: For example, to verify the APIs called by the Activity sample in the WDK, first build the sample in Visual Studio.

trans-unit.source: Then open a command prompt and navigate to the directory containing the tool, for example C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\bin\\x64.
trans-unit.target: Then open a command prompt and navigate to the directory containing the tool, for example C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\bin\\x64.

trans-unit.source: Enter the following command:
trans-unit.target: Enter the following command:

trans-unit.source: apivalidator.exe -DriverPackagePath:"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\src\\usb\\umdf2\_fx2\\Debug\\\\" -SupportedApiXmlFiles:"c:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\build\\universalDDIs\\x64\\UniversalDDIs.xml"
trans-unit.target: apivalidator.exe -DriverPackagePath:"C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\src\\usb\\umdf2\_fx2\\Debug\\\\" -SupportedApiXmlFiles:"c:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\build\\universalDDIs\\x64\\UniversalDDIs.xml"

trans-unit.source: The command produces the following output:
trans-unit.target: The command produces the following output:

trans-unit.source: The XML files that enumerate the valid APIs for Universal Windows drivers are located in C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\build\\universalDDIs\\*<arch>*.
trans-unit.target: The XML files that enumerate the valid APIs for Universal Windows drivers are located in C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Windows Kits\\10\\build\\universalDDIs\\*<arch>*.

trans-unit.source: Troubleshooting
trans-unit.target: Troubleshooting

trans-unit.source: If ApiValidator.exe outputs an incorrect format error such as the following:
trans-unit.target: If ApiValidator.exe outputs an incorrect format error such as the following:

trans-unit.source: Use this workaround:
trans-unit.target: Use this workaround:

trans-unit.source: Open Project properties, navigate to **General**, and rename **Output Directory** to the following:
trans-unit.target: Open Project properties, navigate to **General**, and rename **Output Directory** to the following:

trans-unit.source: Rebuild the solution.
trans-unit.target: Rebuild the solution.
